intro: Biermannia kidmancoxii, commonly known as the Kidman's biermannia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Biermannia kidmancoxii is often found in heathlands and is a valuable component of the local flora.
